question: If the length of the diagonal AC of a square ABCD is 5.2 cm, then the area of the square is :
explanation:
Side of square = $latex \\frac{Diagonal}{\\sqrt{2}}&s=1$
âˆ´ Area = $latex \\frac{Diagonal^{2}}{2}&s=1$
$latex =\\frac{\\left ( 5.2 \\right )^{2}}{2}&s=2$ $latex = \\frac{27.04}{2}&s=1$
= 13.52 sq.cm
Hence option [C] is the right answer.
